Pre-Game Insights: The Scottish team had their last training session on Thursday morning before heading to Munich.
Captain Andy Robertson stated, 'We know that's what's at stake. We have to be at our best and if we can do that, who knows where we'll be come 23 June.'

Scotland manager Steve Clarke expressed, 'It's been a long time since 1998 when we actually travelled abroad to appear in a tournament like this. We're proud we've been able to do back-to-back tournaments and hopefully by the end of this we'll be even more proud at having done something a bit more special.'

Defender Scott McKenna noted, 'It's a great opportunity for them to come and experience a tournament on foreign soil for the first time in a long time. I think the Tartan Army will be very excited, they're travelling in their numbers and I hope we can put in a performance they can be proud of and celebrate as well.'
The ambition is to try and get out of the group, but the only way we can do that is to take it one game at a time. This week we are only focused on Germany.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lots of excited Scotland fans, many dressed in vibrant tartan, have travelled over to Germany in the hopes of seeing the team claim a victory against tough opponents.
An estimated 200,000 fans are expected to head over during the next few weeks of the competition.
